attributes.content: De.Tales is an international architecture and design studio founded by Igor Rebosio and Giuseppe Varsavia, located in Milan's vibrant and industrial Navigli district. The studio has become a notable address in Milanese design, reflecting its strong presence in the field.

body.value:
De.Tales is an international architecture and design studio founded by Igor Rebosio and Giuseppe Varsavia, located in Milan's vibrant and industrial Navigli district. The studio has become a notable address in Milanese design, reflecting its strong presence in the field.

With over twenty years of experience in architecture and interior design, De.Tales has established recognized expertise across various sectors, particularly in hospitality and luxury residential projects. The firm leverages its extensive know-how, supported by a reliable, multinational, and multidisciplinary team, to coordinate and manage complex projects with global reach.

De.Tales approaches each project with a unique perspective, crafting a tailored "Design Tale" for each client. They believe every concept has a story to tell and that attention to detail is paramount. This philosophy results in unique and original narratives that transform briefs and expectations into harmonious, exclusive projects, hallmarking the studio's distinct and recognizable style.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Rand Merchant Bank (RMB), a division of FirstRand Bank Limited, is a leading African corporate and investment bank and part of one of the largest financial services groups in Africa. They offer clients innovative, value-added advisory, funding, trading, corporate banking, and principal investing solutions.

body.value:
Rand Merchant Bank (RMB), a division of FirstRand Bank Limited, is a leading African corporate and investment bank and part of one of the largest financial services groups in Africa. They offer clients innovative, value-added advisory, funding, trading, corporate banking, and principal investing solutions.

As the corporate and investment banking arm of FirstRand Bank Limited, which is wholly owned by FirstRand Limited, RMB has access to a network of retail banks in 25 African countries, as well as branches and representative offices in Namibia, Botswana, Nigeria, Angola, Kenya, the UK, India, China, and the Middle East.

In the business of corporate and investment banking, its not just the thought but the quality and inventiveness of the thinking that counts. RMB's ability to think differently and their collaborative spirit set them apart, enabling them to deliver on their brand promise: Traditional values. Innovative ideas.

attributes.content: SGI (Studio Galli Ingegneria) is an Italian consultancy firm specializing in water, environmental, and civil engineering. attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Jiangsu Etern Company Limited | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Jiangsu Etern Company Limited is situated in the heart of the Changjiang River Delta, within Wujiang City Fenhu Economic Development Zone, strategically located at the junction of Jiangsu, Zhejiang, and Shanghai. Benefiting from this unique geographic advantage and a conducive development environment, Etern has thrived since its establishment in 1978.

body.value:
Jiangsu Etern Company Limited is situated in the heart of the Changjiang River Delta, within Wujiang City Fenhu Economic Development Zone, strategically located at the junction of Jiangsu, Zhejiang, and Shanghai. Benefiting from this unique geographic advantage and a conducive development environment, Etern has thrived since its establishment in 1978.

Over more than three decades of relentless business exploration and perseverance, Etern has evolved into a large-scale, high-tech enterprise. The company encompasses over 10 enterprise groups through mergers, share holdings, equity participation, and acquisitions, spanning diverse industries including telecommunications products and cables, EPC power turnkey projects, automobiles, new materials, and others.

Etern made its market debut in 1997, emerging as a pioneering player in China's national optical fiber cable industry. This milestone laid the groundwork for diversification across industries and continuous technological advancements. Today, Etern is renowned for its extensive range of products, including general optical fiber cables, communication copper cables, special optical fiber cables, indoor and outdoor optical fiber cables, data cables, optical devices, and other telecommunication products. It stands as one of China's largest enterprises with the most comprehensive variety in the cable industry.

Adhering strictly to ISO9001:2000 and ISO14001 standards, Etern's commitment to quality is underscored by international UL safety certifications for many of its products. Its communication cables have been integral to numerous national trunk projects and are trusted by major entities such as China Telecom, China Mobile, China Unicom, and various industries including aviation, railway, subway, and petroleum.

Etern has forged strong partnerships with leading telecommunications equipment manufacturers like Huawei, Alcatel-Lucent, Datang, and UT Starcom. Its cable products are exported to over forty countries across South America, South Africa, Southeast Asia, and beyond.

Recognized as a "Chinese Famous Brand," "National Large Enterprise," "Chinese High-tech Enterprise," "National Advanced Quality Management Enterprise," and more, Etern continues to innovate and expand its business scope. Beyond cables, the company now provides comprehensive communication solutions and services, demonstrating its adaptability and leadership in the telecommunications industry amidst evolving market dynamics.

attributes.title: Ministry of Trade and Industry, South Sudan

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Ministry of Trade and Industry, South Sudan | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Trade & Industry serves as the principal advisor to the government on trade, industrial, and private sector development policies in South Sudan. Its mandate includes formulating and implementing strategies to enhance domestic and international trade and industry. Acting as the advocate for the private sector within the government, it monitors and executes private sector development programs. The Ministry ensures South Sudan optimizes benefits from international trade relations and oversees orderly domestic trade practices.

body.value: The Ministry of Trade & Industry serves as the principal advisor to the government on trade, industrial, and private sector development policies in South Sudan. Its mandate includes formulating and implementing strategies to enhance domestic and international trade and industry. Acting as the advocate for the private sector within the government, it monitors and executes private sector development programs. The Ministry ensures South Sudan optimizes benefits from international trade relations and oversees orderly domestic trade practices. It also prioritizes strengthening trade ties under the Most Favored Nation principle, aligned with South Sudans World Trade Organization membership. Emphasis remains on market diversification and promoting non-traditional exports to cultivate an export-oriented economy. In the industrial sphere, the Ministry focuses on fostering competitive sub-sectors capable of penetrating global markets with value-added products derived from local resources.

attributes.content: CGCOC Group Co., Ltd | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Founded in May 2010, CGCOC Water Co., Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of CGCOC Group Co., Ltd, a transnational group invested by large state-owned enterprises. The group integrates high-end consultation, investment, infrastructure, commerce, and logistics/transport. CGCOC Water has expanded its business across more than 10 Asian and African countries, ranking among the top 30 Chinese enterprises in overseas economic cooperation and within the top 225 global project contractors in the ENR.

body.value:
Founded in May 2010, CGCOC Water Co., Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of CGCOC Group Co., Ltd, a transnational group invested by large state-owned enterprises. The group integrates high-end consultation, investment, infrastructure, commerce, and logistics/transport. CGCOC Water has expanded its business across more than 10 Asian and African countries, ranking among the top 30 Chinese enterprises in overseas economic cooperation and within the top 225 global project contractors in the ENR. It has consistently ranked among the top three in the Foreign Trade field in Zhejiang Province and is recognized as a Double Top Ten Enterprise by the Foreign Economic and Trade Committee of Zhejiang, also serving as a vice president member of the Foreign Contractors Association of Zhejiang Province.

Since its establishment, CGCOC Water has aimed to create a professional platform for the water industry, adhering to CGCs development philosophy of cooperation for fortune and innovation for development. The company focuses on one-stop service and integrated development, providing comprehensive water industry solutions that include project implementation and management, technical advice and support, goods trade, and equipment installation tailored to international standards in overseas markets.

Currently, CGCOC Water employs over two hundred domestic and foreign staff, including more than 50 engineers with intermediate and senior technical titles. The company holds relevant qualifications in foreign trade and economic projects, such as Class A qualification for domestic sewage, qualification for overseas contracts, and licenses for overseas investment, maintaining a solid long-term banking credit history, which ensures robust support for its long-term overseas project investment and construction.

Focusing on the African market, CGCOC Water has developed its businesses in countries such as Nigeria, Ethiopia, Cameroon, and Djibouti. By leveraging domestic advantages, CGCOC Water pioneers the export of Chinese technology, standards, and capital, achieving sustainable and steady development while serving local countries.

attributes.content: Lepelle Northern Water (LNW) is a public water utility, wholly owned by the state and established under the Water Services Act No. 108 of 1997. They are committed to delivering quality water services at sustainable levels to meet the needs of their customers. By providing sustainable bulk services, they aim to change lives. Their operations and business conduct are guided by values rooted in the Batho Pele principles.

attributes.content: NPD Ltd is a well-established civil engineering and construction company in Rwanda, with over 25 years of experience in delivering practical and innovative solutions to its clients.

body.value:
NPD Ltd is a well-established civil engineering and construction company in Rwanda, with over 25 years of experience in delivering practical and innovative solutions to its clients.

NPD COTRACO Ltd was the result of a merger between two entities, COTRACO s.a.r.l. and Nyarutarama Property Developers (NPD) s.a.r.l. Prior to the merger, COTRACO focused solely on the provision of prefabricated concrete products.NPD Ltd was established in 1996 as a Kigali based property developer specializing in the development of housing estates. The combined expertise of these organizations has granted NPD Ltd. a profound understanding of civil engineering works and geographically specific needs.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: As Ghana, particularly Accra, evolved into a cosmopolitan hub, the Church of Pentecost faced the challenge of effectively reaching and fellowshiping with a diverse population. It was crucial for the church's gospel outreach to be inclusive of people from various nationalities, traditions, and cultures, ensuring they felt comfortable in fellowship.

body.value:
As Ghana, particularly Accra, evolved into a cosmopolitan hub, the Church of Pentecost faced the challenge of effectively reaching and fellowshiping with a diverse population. It was crucial for the church's gospel outreach to be inclusive of people from various nationalities, traditions, and cultures, ensuring they felt comfortable in fellowship.

The contemporary Church of Pentecost expanded globally, establishing branches in over 30 countries across Asia, Europe, Africa, and the Americas. This international presence posed another challenge: providing effective and comfortable fellowship for Ghanaian members visiting from external branches during holidays in Ghana."

The contemporary Church of Pentecost expanded globally, establishing branches in over 30 countries across Asia, Europe, Africa, and the Americas. attributes.content: Confederation of African Football (CAF) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: CAF is the governing body of African football and was founded in 1957. The founding members are Egypt, Sudan, Ethiopia and South Africa. With a membership of 54 Member Associations, the secretariat is based in Egypt. At the FIFA Congress in 1954 held in Berne, Switzerland, it was voted to recognize Africa as a Confederation. This gave the continent the right to appoint its first representative to the FIFA Executive Committee and the member was Abdel Aziz Abdallah Salem of Egypt.

attributes.content: Nthane Brothers (Pty) Ltd was established in 1977 by three brothers who shared a development vision focused on Lesotho. Leadership was provided from the onset by Mr. Tseliso Nthane, who had a passion for construction and transportation logistics. The company began with a small fleet of vehicles available for hire. As the demand for plant hire and transportation grew, the company expanded its offerings to include building and construction services.

body.value: Nthane Brothers (Pty) Ltd was established in 1977 by three brothers who shared a development vision focused on Lesotho. Leadership was provided from the onset by Mr. Tseliso Nthane, who had a passion for construction and transportation logistics. The company began with a small fleet of vehicles available for hire. As the demand for plant hire and transportation grew, the company expanded its offerings to include building and construction services. Each area of operation was maintained on a fairly large scale, leading to the present-day Nthane Brothers, which is now the leading construction and plant hire company in Lesotho. Their track record demonstrates how this integration and commitment help deliver projects that enhance the reputation of all parties involved, provide the best value to clients and the local community, and are financially profitable for Nthane Brothers.

attributes.content: Dubai Investments is a publicly listed UAE based multi-asset investment Group, managing a diverse portfolio of businesses, generating sustainable financial returns to its shareholders. body.value: Dubai Investments is a publicly listed UAE based multi-asset investment Group, managing a diverse portfolio of businesses, generating sustainable financial returns to its shareholders. Established in 1995, Dubai Investments is one of the leading investments Group in the UAE, initiating new businesses and partnering with dynamic entities, creating strategic investment opportunities across the region. With more than 15,000 shareholders, a paid-up capital of AED 4.25 billion and total assets worth AED 20.9 billion, the Group applies insight and experience to organically expand and be a reliable growth driver for businesses within sectors like real estate, building materials, construction & contracting, financial services, healthcare and education among others. The Group's diverse portfolio consists of over 30+ wholly and partly owned companies. Dubai Investments interest and investments reflect the Companys continued focus on business diversification to drive growth in line with evolving industry trends. Focused on leveraging strengths with an interest in establishing existing and new business opportunities with a long-term, strategic and creative approach and with an emphasis on sustainable returns and capital growth, Dubai Investments collaborates on investment strategies meeting the changing needs of the economy and the societies in which it operates. Complementing the strategic objectives and creating value for stakeholders, the Group pursues growth through mergers and acquisitions and business expansions.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Established in 1962 as Jiangsu Construction Group Co., Ltd., the company underwent several transformations over the years. Initially named Jiangsu Construction Engineering Bureau in 1978 and later Jiangsu Construction Engineering Corporation in 1983, it primarily managed administrative functions for the province's construction sector. In 1996, it transitioned into an economic entity, achieving group company status in 2001.

body.value:
Established in 1962 as Jiangsu Construction Group Co., Ltd., the company underwent several transformations over the years. Initially named Jiangsu Construction Engineering Bureau in 1978 and later Jiangsu Construction Engineering Corporation in 1983, it primarily managed administrative functions for the province's construction sector. In 1996, it transitioned into an economic entity, achieving group company status in 2001. Renamed as "Jiangsu Construction Group Co., Ltd." in 2012 during the 18th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the company has thrived in a conducive business environment, becoming the sole provincial state-owned enterprise in the construction engineering sector.

Known domestically and internationally for its superior construction expertise and top-notch services, Jiangsu Construction Group adheres to a strategy of undertaking projects, establishing a presence, and expanding market reach in its engineering endeavors. This approach has propelled the company's business scale and brand reputation to new heights, marking significant milestones in its growth and development.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The National Social Security Authority (NSSA) was established under the National Social Security Act (Chapter 17:04) of 1989, enacted by Parliament. This legislation grants authority to the Minister of Public Service, Labour, and Social Welfare to create social security schemes aimed at providing benefits to all employees. NSSA is responsible for the administration of each scheme and fund established under this Act.

body.value:
The National Social Security Authority (NSSA) was established under the National Social Security Act (Chapter 17:04) of 1989, enacted by Parliament. This legislation grants authority to the Minister of Public Service, Labour, and Social Welfare to create social security schemes aimed at providing benefits to all employees. NSSA is responsible for the administration of each scheme and fund established under this Act.

Social security involves implementing public policy measures designed to safeguard individuals during life events or conditions that jeopardize their livelihood and well-being. Such situations include sickness, workplace injuries, unemployment, disability, old age, retirement, and death.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Cameroon operates as a unitary presidential republic under the 1972 Constitution. The President, elected for a seven-year term with the possibility of reelection, serves as both head of state and government. The President appoints the Prime Minister and oversees the Council of Ministers. The bicameral legislature consists of the National Assembly and the Senate. The country is divided into regions and departments for local governance. The judiciary is independent, though judges are appointed by the President to the Supreme Court.

body.value: Cameroon operates as a unitary presidential republic under the 1972 Constitution. The President, elected for a seven-year term with the possibility of reelection, serves as both head of state and government. The President appoints the Prime Minister and oversees the Council of Ministers. The bicameral legislature consists of the National Assembly and the Senate. The country is divided into regions and departments for local governance. The judiciary is independent, though judges are appointed by the President to the Supreme Court. Challenges include managing diversity, promoting economic growth, and addressing human rights issues, with stability and effective governance as key priorities.

attributes.content: Maputo Port Development Company (MPDC) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Maputo Port Development Company (MPDC) is a national private entity formed through a partnership between the Mozambican Railway Company (Caminhos de Ferro de Moambique) and Portus Indico. Portus Indico itself includes Grindrod, DP World, and the local company Mozambique Gestores. On April 15, 2003, MPDC was awarded the concession for Maputos Port for a 15-year period, with an option for a 15-year extension.

body.value: The Maputo Port Development Company (MPDC) is a national private entity formed through a partnership between the Mozambican Railway Company (Caminhos de Ferro de Moambique) and Portus Indico. Portus Indico itself includes Grindrod, DP World, and the local company Mozambique Gestores. On April 15, 2003, MPDC was awarded the concession for Maputos Port for a 15-year period, with an option for a 15-year extension. In June 2010, the concession period was extended for an additional 15 years, and in February 2024, the government granted an extension until 2058 based on a comprehensive plan to expand the port's capacity.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Senegal is a multiparty republic. The 2001 constitution provides for a strongly centralized presidential regimethe head of state is the president, who is elected by direct universal adult suffrage and can be elected to two five-year terms. Theprime minister, appointed by the president, is thehead of government. Ministers are appointed by the president. Senegal has a unicameral legislature (the National Assembly), with most members directly elected; the remaining members are indirectly elected. All legislators serve five-year terms.

body.value: Senegal is a multiparty republic. The 2001 constitution provides for a strongly centralized presidential regimethe head of state is the president, who is elected by direct universal adult suffrage and can be elected to two five-year terms. The prime minister, appointed by the president, is the head of government. Ministers are appointed by the president. Senegal has a unicameral legislature (the National Assembly), with most members directly elected; the remaining members are indirectly elected. All legislators serve five-year terms. Judicial, executive and legislative powers are separated.

Originating with a focus on luxury residential projects, the firm has, over the years, expanded its horizons and now proudly serves a diverse clientele with cutting-edge and visionary design solutions for both commercial ventures and high-end residences across the Middle East and on an international scale.Multi-award-winning architecture and interior design firm with offices in Dubai, London, and Kerala.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Danida Sustainable Infrastructure Finance (DSIF) serves as the primary Danish aid delivery mechanism for large-scale infrastructure projects in developing countries. It is a central component of the official development cooperation funded by Denmarks Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Danida) and is administered by the Investment Fund for Developing Countries (IFU).

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Qatar Airways has been a pioneer in environmental sustainability, becoming the first airline in the Middle East to achieve the highest level of IATA's Environmental Assessment (IEnvA) program. It was also the inaugural signatory to the Buckingham Palace Declaration, setting the industry standard for preventing illegal wildlife trafficking in aviation since March 2016.Operating flights to over 170 destinations globally, Qatar Airways connects passengers through its hub at Hamad International Airport in Doha, recognized as the 'World's Best Airport' by Skytrax in 2021, 2022, and 2024.

body.value: Qatar Airways has been a pioneer in environmental sustainability, becoming the first airline in the Middle East to achieve the highest level of IATA's Environmental Assessment (IEnvA) program. It was also the inaugural signatory to the Buckingham Palace Declaration, setting the industry standard for preventing illegal wildlife trafficking in aviation since March 2016.Operating flights to over 170 destinations globally, Qatar Airways connects passengers through its hub at Hamad International Airport in Doha, recognized as the 'World's Best Airport' by Skytrax in 2021, 2022, and 2024. In 2024, Hamad International Airport also secured the accolades for 'Best Airport in the Middle East' for ten consecutive years and 'World's Best Airport Shopping' for the second consecutive year.

attributes.title: Ecowas Bank for Investment and Development (EBID)

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Ecowas Bank for Investment and Development (EBID) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The ECOWAS Bank for Investment and Development (EBID) is a specialized financial institution established by the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS). Its primary objective is to promote the economic development of West African member states through financing of public and private sector projects. EBID provides financial assistance in the form of loans, guarantees, and equity investments to support infrastructure development, agriculture, industry, telecommunications, and other key sectors contributing to regional economic growth.

body.value: The ECOWAS Bank for Investment and Development (EBID) is a specialized financial institution established by the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS). Its primary objective is to promote the economic development of West African member states through financing of public and private sector projects. EBID provides financial assistance in the form of loans, guarantees, and equity investments to support infrastructure development, agriculture, industry, telecommunications, and other key sectors contributing to regional economic growth. Additionally, EBID plays a crucial role in fostering regional integration and cooperation among ECOWAS member states by facilitating cross-border investments and promoting economic stability in the region.
